description.narrative: In Sudan, two decades of war and conflict have devastated the country and led to the internal displacement of broad sections of the population, a majority of whom are women. In the Nuba region, internally displaced women confront high levels of poverty, which are exacerbated by ethnic tensions and strains between host and displaced communities. This programme seeks to promote social cohesion between host and internally displaced communities by providing training on conflict resolution and peace building and by simultaneously improving the livelihoods of the internally displaced women, their families and the host communities. Through a combination of interventions, the programme intends to involve marginalized women in community decision-making processes and improve their economic status by introducing them to diversified agricultural activities. It will economically empower low-income and rural women, most of whom are heads of households, and will positively impact the livelihood of their direct family members
